nodes.name: finalize

devdoc.author: Andrea Bruno 585457
devdoc.details: The following comments are written using the Solidity NatSpec Format.

activateAuction().details: Only the seller can invoke it.

bid(bytes32).details: This function can be invoked only during the commitment phase.

params._bidHash: this is the hash of the tuple <value,nonce>. See `GenerateBid` contract for more info.

params._commitment_len: the lenght of the commitment phase.
params._itemName: is a short description of what is going to be sold.
params._min_deposit: is the minimum deposit decided by the seller.
params._opening_len: the lenght of the opening phase.
params._reservePrice: is the reserve price decided by the seller.
params._withdrawal_len: the lenght of the withdrawal phase.

finalize().details: The function is declare internal, so no one externally can invoke it.

params._nonce: is the nonce of the bid previously generated.

startOpening().details: This function can be invoked only by the seller.

startWithdrawal().details: This function can be invoked only by the seller.

withdrawal().details: The security pattern Checks-Effects-Interaction is respected.

devdoc.title: Vickrey Auction contract

activateAuction().notice: This function will activate the auction.

bid(bytes32).notice: This function allow people to make bid.Note that a bid will be taken into account if the value sent is >= the minimum deposit.

methods.constructor: The constructor of the Dutch auction.

finalize().notice: This function finalize and close the contract.In case of surplus, this ether will be sent to a charity address.

open(bytes32).notice: This function allow people to open their bid.

startOpening().notice: This function activate the Opening phase

startWithdrawal().notice: This function start the withdrawal phase.

withdrawal().notice: This function allow people to retire their bid.Note that only half of the deposit will be refunded.The other half goes to the seller

userdoc.notice: This contract implements the Vickrey auction functionalities.
